alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley; Union (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 17 at 8:16PM EDT until July 18 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA...SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA AND NORTHERN DEARBORN COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA... At 815 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Brookville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Bright, West College Corner, Oldenburg, Salem, Logan, Sunman, St. Leon, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Huntersville, Cottage Grove, Penntown, Interstate 74 at US Route 52, Rockdale, Sharptown, Saint Peter, Charlottesville and Billingsville. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 146 and 170. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
